item.title: ADA Short-Term Breaks $1 Mark, 24-Hour Gain Reaches 13.44%
item.description: On August 14th, according to HTX market data, ADA briefly exceeded $1 and is now trading at $0.9901, with a 24-hour price increase of 13.44%.

item.title: Binance: Cherry AI (AIBOT) TGE Participation Requirement 224 Points
item.description: On August 14th, according to official information, Binance Alpha users who have 224 or more points are eligible to participate in the Cherry AI (AIBOT) TGE event through the Alpha event page. Participating in this event will require 15 points.Subscription Time: from 4:00 PM to 6:00 PM on August 14th, 2025 (UTC+8).

item.title: Insider: MetaMask Stablecoin mUSD Set to Launch by End of Month
item.description: On August 14th, according to sources having knowledge of the matter, the crypto wallet MetaMask is anticipated to disclose details of its proprietary stablecoin mUSD as early as this week. Previously, this project came to light due to a governance proposal that was prematurely released and promptly deleted, with the plan to go live by the end of this month.mUSD was issued with the help of the stablecoin payment service provider Bridge (acquired by the fintech company Stripe earlier this year) and the stablecoin issuance protocol M^0. Its custody and asset management services are provided by the alternative asset management firm Blackstone. (CoinDesk)

item.title: Analysis: South Korea's Korean Won Stablecoin Faces Uncertainty Due to Onshore Policy Restrictions
item.description: August 14th: The Bank of Korea has given up its central bank digital currency pilot and switched to stablecoins issued by the private sector, which has triggered accelerated efforts by fintech companies and banks. KakaoBank is contemplating entering the issuance and custody business. Meanwhile, Upbit and Naver Pay are collaborating to develop payment-type tokens in order to narrow the local and global crypto price gap. However, due to the long-standing restrictions on "onshore" Korean won transactions, overseas institutions are unable to directly exchange Korean won abroad. Korean won stablecoins can only be used for KYC addresses connected to Korea, thus hindering cross-border settlement.Analysts believe that this token lacks a payment efficiency advantage in the local instant and free transfer system, and its main application is likely to be limited to domestic scenarios. (CoinDesk)

item.title: pump.fun has captured over 70% of the market share in the last 24 hours, causing Letsbonk to fall to 17.9%.
item.description: On August 14th, according to Jupiter Data, on the Solana token issuance platform market share leaderboard in the past 24 hours, pump.fun took the lead with 70.6%, Letsbonk ranked second with 17.9%, and BAGS ranked third with 6.33%.

item.title: Bitget Launches ETH Community-wide Lottery Event, with Individuals Having the Chance to Win up to 30 ETH
item.description: August 14th. Bitget has initiated an ETH Carnival Lucky Draw event. Both new and existing users are eligible to participate and share the rewards. During the event, users can acquire a lucky draw chance by fulfilling corresponding contract trading volume tasks. New users can have up to 8 draws, while existing users can have up to 7 draws. The greater the number of draw attempts, the higher the likelihood of winning the grand prize, with a maximum individual reward of 30 ETH.This event has a low entry barrier with a 1000 USDT contract trading volume. Once the task is completed, 1 draw qualification will be unlocked, and the winning rate is 100%. The total prize pool includes rewards such as ETH, JD E Cards, USDT, and more. All event rewards will be automatically credited to users' accounts without the need for manual claiming.The detailed rules have been released on the Bitget official platform. Users can click the "Join Now" button to sign up and participate in the event. The event

item.title: Bitcoin Briefly Falls Below $123,000
item.description: On August 14th, based on HTX market data, Bitcoin briefly fell below $123,000 and is currently trading at $123,084.

item.title: The WLFI OTC price is currently at $0.3, with a 24-hour trading volume exceeding $1.56 million.
item.description: On August 14th, based on the market data of Whales Market, the OTC price of WLFI is currently at $0.3. The 24-hour trading volume exceeds $1.56 million, and the total trading volume exceeds $30 million.

item.title: A new address withdrew 3606 ETH and 1.41 million WLD, with a total value of approximately $18.56 million
item.description: On August 14th, based on the monitoring of LookOnChain, a newly established wallet made a withdrawal of 3,606 ETH (approximately $17.06 million) and 1.41 million WLD (approximately $1.55 million) 8 hours ago. The total value of this withdrawal is approximately $18.56 million.

item.title: A certain Smart Money went 2x long on SOL 1 hour ago, with a position value of over $13.5 million.
item.description: Update, August 14th: Based on on-chain data, Whale Wallet X initiated a 2x long position on SOL on Hyperliquid more than an hour ago. The position value exceeded $13.5 million, with an entry price of $207.83. This address also holds 3x long positions on SUI and XRP.This address has amassed over $5 million in profits on Hyperliquid.
